column4: hi! how can I connect to a USB-device that is recognized but not active in vmware? (http://img262.imageshack.us/my.php?image=usbex0.jpg)
the two that are checked on the image are there (without name though... unknown device) but the 3 others arent...
if you swap usb ports round does it switch in the VM (id shutdown the vm first)
are you using hubs? does it work if you connect direct
ok, no hubs, directly connected to the laptop. they don't switch in the VM...
set the interface as DHCP and itwill get an IP off your router
then you wil need to set the interface you connect with to fall into the same subnet as the device, you will also need a crossover cable as you are connecting peer to peer
a NAS can be on a router, as long as there is a logical link it will work
set the interface to be a static IP and set it to fall in to the netmask used by the device.
its a p2p lan, there is no gateway
how can I tell the network manager?
you set the interface to Manual, then specify the details
I got so far... Then it asks for Adress, Subnet and Gateway...
yes, set it to similar to the device, but change the last octet of the address, the subnet will be the same
what is the address of the device?

in the manual it says "open a web browser and enter the IP address of the NAS: http://169.254.100.100:8080/ (make sure the IP address of your PC is configured to the same subnet, e.g. 169.254.100.1. I cannot klick apply in the network settings with IP 169.254.100.10 and subnet 169.254.0.0... that should be correct though, right?
